message.content: This question requires knowledge about the relationship between thermal conductivity and electrical conductivity. Thermal energy insulators are materials that have low thermal conductivity, meaning they do not conduct heat well. Similarly, good electrical insulators are materials that have high electrical resistance, meaning they do not conduct electricity well. The rubber sandwiched between two iron slabs is a good example because rubber is both a good thermal insulator and a good electrical insulator. Option (A) is incorrect because metallic rocks on the ground are good thermal conductors, but not necessarily good electrical insulators. Option (B) is incorrect because a fan on the ceiling is not necessarily a good thermal or electrical insulator. Option (D) is incorrect because metal knives for sale are usually good thermal conductors and not good electrical insulators.

This question requires some knowledge about the properties of materials. Thermal energy insulators are substances that do not conduct heat well, while electrical insulators are substances that do not conduct electricity well. The option (C) states that there is rubber sandwiched between two iron slabs. Rubber is a good thermal insulator because it does not conduct heat well, and it is also a good electrical insulator because it does not conduct electricity well. The other options are incorrect because they do not mention the presence of a material that serves as a good electrical insulator. Metallic rocks on the ground (option A) would conduct both heat and electricity. A fan on the ceiling (option B) does not have any insulating properties. Metal knives for sale (option D) would conduct both heat and electricity.

This question requires knowledge about the properties of thermal and electrical insulators. Thermal insulators are materials that do not conduct heat well, while electrical insulators are materials that do not conduct electricity well. Option (C) is the correct answer because rubber is a common thermal insulator and it is also a good electrical insulator. Option (A) is incorrect because metallic rocks are not typically good thermal or electrical insulators. Option (B) is incorrect because a fan on the ceiling does not have any relation to being a good thermal or electrical insulator. Option (D) is incorrect because metal knives are not known for their insulating properties.

This question requires knowledge about the properties of different materials. Thermal energy insulators are materials that do not conduct heat well. Similarly, good electrical insulators are materials that do not conduct electricity well. Rubber is a commonly used material for both thermal and electrical insulation because it has high resistance to both heat and electricity. Option (A) is incorrect because metallic rocks, such as metal ores, are good thermal conductors and therefore not good thermal insulators. Option (B) is incorrect because a fan on the ceiling does not act as a thermal or electrical insulator. Option (D) is incorrect because metal knives are good thermal conductors and therefore not good thermal insulators like rubber.

Thermal energy insulators prevent the transfer of heat, while electrical insulators prevent the flow of electrical current. Rubber is commonly used as both a thermal insulator and an electrical insulator, which makes option (C) the correct answer. 

Option (A) is incorrect because metallic rocks on the ground, like most metals, are good thermal conductors and thus poor thermal insulators. Option (B) is incorrect because a fan on the ceiling may help circulate air, but it does not necessarily provide thermal or electrical insulation. Option (D) is incorrect because metal knives are conductors of both thermal and electrical energy, so they are not good thermal or electrical insulators.
